TopicTitle: [1.2.1] Spacetux - Contract Pack: Unmanned Contracts, Rover Contracts, Grand Tours and Sprite Missions

> Confirmed, looking into it
> 

Nuts, a file got left out.  Add the following to a file "group.cfg" in the directory ContractPacks/Spacetux/RoverMissions:

    CONTRACT_GROUP
    {
    //trace = trueagent = Space Penguins, IncminVersion = 1.15.0// Name of the contract groupname = RoverMissionsGroupdisplayName = Rover Missions
    }

I'm working on an upate

update was pushed out.

There is a known bug where you can be asked to put a probe into a kolniari (?) orbit, where the Apple is outside the <abbr title="Sphere of Influence">SOI</abbr>.  No solution at this time other than to not take those contracts.
Can this contract mod be played with <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> and <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>?

> 
> 
> 22 hours ago, deleted said:
> 
> 
> Can this contract mod be played with <abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)"><abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr></abbr> and <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)"><abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr></abbr>?
> 

Yes.

Ignore the Kolniya orbit contracts right now, there is an update in the works for ContractConfigurator which I'm waiting for to fix a problem.

Just released an update:

0.3.22  

Added checks for impossible (in-game) Kolniya orbits  

Added Tundra orbits

You MUST be running Contractconfigurator 1.17.0 or later (just released last night)
Just released another update:  0.3.25, fixes more problems with Kolniya orbits

In my save the Grand Tours contract pack doesn't appear in the contract configurator tab, can someone help me please?

Was a mistake I have because now the Grand Tours contract pack doesn't appear with the name of the contract pack in the contract configurator tab and this was my confusion.

I accidentally 'fast-forwarded' SUPER far out and made one of my exploration contracts for rovers fail. Is there any way to get it back? Either through the debug/cheat menu or some other way? It was the first one you get for exploring with a new rover on Kerbin.

some ideas for new probes mission:

1. land probe /Eve/Laythe/(and back to Kerbin) **without** parachute (so peoples can build unmanned spaceplane)

2. **dock** 1 **unmanned** probe to 2nd ship (any with dockport) and/maybe/or XXXXX go to newSOI/land/splashdown  at planetoid XXXXX

3. **transport XXXX units of fuel/monoprop** to station (**launch** **and dock** unmanned cargo-tanker to spec. spacestation status ship, aka real life)

4. **send unmanned rover** to planets (unmanned, has wheels, status landed atXXX planetoid, move to 4 waypoints in 5km) 

5.  dive unmanned **submarine** in Eve/Laythe (splashed down unmanned) and move it at 3 random waypoints in 2 km radius 100 m near (below sea level) also unmanned

6. send **only ion-propelld** probe to planetoid XXXX and land /splashdown/smash-to-ground (no <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/OX/<abbr title="Solid fuel Rocket Booster">SRB</abbr>)

7. send **only <abbr title="Solid fuel Rocket Booster">SRB</abbr> engines** probe to planetoid XXXX and smash/land/return back to kerbin (aka mission impossible for many players ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") )

> 3 hours ago, RavenPanther said:

> 
> I accidentally 'fast-forwarded' SUPER far out and made one of my exploration contracts for rovers fail. Is there any way to get it back? Either through the debug/cheat menu or some other way? It was the first one you get for exploring with a new rover on Kerbin.
> 

You could do one of two things:

1.  Edit the save file and delete it, or, possibly, change it from being failed to in progress.  I'm not sure exactly how to do this, contact [@nightingale](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/119307-nightingale/) for help with that, he wrote ContractConfigurator

2.  Just wait, I believe you will get it offered again.
With CC updated, will this update soon, or should it work out of the box?
It should work out of the box, but I haven't yet had a chance to test it.

How does one install this? Do I drop these into contract configurator or into game data? If the former is the answer, do I drop the whole master folder into CC or do I open it and spill the contents into CC?

It seems to me that the science yield of the Unmanned contracts is <abbr title="Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it.">OP</abbr>. Getting like 38 science points for merely putting a probe in a Mun orbit feels like cheating to me in hard mode career. It's more than all your the scientific instruments can get you (at least in early game). Is it scaled according to the celestial body? If yes, I think it should be nerfed significantly (like 5-10 times).
I'll take a look at it, thanks

I looked and all the contracts have a science reward of 25. Depending on your difficulty settings, the Mun would get 50 science for high orbit and 75 for low orbit. Which is indeed a lot.

Personally I would say the science reward should be reduced to around 5. If you want I can make a pull request.

While I have not 'tested' it, I have used it throughout my early 1.2 career play through. The only issue I have found is that the orbit a probe and return it safely contract seems to complete upon the next returned ship from orbit after acceptance of the contract, regardless of whether or not it is a probe. Could be a mod conflict, so possibly an isolated incident. 

Also the aforementioned generous contract rewards..

Cheers,
